info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 02 at 12:47PM PST until January 04 at 12:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Winter Weather Returns Tonight through Early Tuesday... .Another weather system will bring snow to the mountains of interior NorCal tonight into early this week. The heaviest snow will occur over the foothills and mountains to the north of Redding late tonight into Monday evening. Significant travel impacts will be possible on Interstate 5 north of Redding. Lighter snowfall accumulations will impact travel over the Southern Cascades and Northern Sierra Nevada on Monday into early Tuesday. Strong winds will also accompany this weather system and could cause limited visibility at times as well as downed tree branches and weakened trees. If you`re planning travel over the mountains early this week, stay in touch with the latest forecasts. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT PST MONDAY NIGHT ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Plan on difficult travel conditions, including during the evening commute on Monday. Damage to trees and power lines is possible due to heavy snow and strong winds. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches above 1500 to 2000 feet, with localized amounts up to 1 to 3 feet above 3000 feet, are expected. * WHERE...Shasta Lake Area / Northern Shasta County including Interstate 5 north of Redding. * WHEN...Midnight Sunday night to midnight Monday night. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for significant reductions in visibility at times. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for wet snow means there will be snow covered roads and limited visibilities. Travel is not recommended while the warning is in effect. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
